intro: Tricuspis mutica, commonly known as the hairy tricuspis, is a flowering plant characterized by its unique tricuspis leaf shape, which features three distinct lobes. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, commonly known as the sunflower family, and is native to specific regions in South America. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Its hairy stems and leaves provide a textured appearance, making it a distinctive addition to botanical gardens. Tricuspis mutica is typically found in moist, shaded environments, thriving in temperate climates.
